intro: Ilex caniensis, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value is due to its year-round foliage and seasonal fruit display. Ilex caniensis is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
